questions.question: As a practice, the Arabs of Mecca would do what with their newborn babies?

choices.answer: Bury them in the ground
Send them to live in care of desert people
Keep them in Mecca to teach them city life
Send them to other cities in Sham or Yemen

imageMetadata.altText: Dust Bowl: Depression on the Way?

questions.question: The care-taker of the Prophet was named _________ from the village of _______

choices.answer: Maysara; Ta'if
Halimah; Bukhara
Ma'moona; Thamud
Halimah; Ta'if

questions.question: Nurse-mothers came to visit Mecca periodically because

choices.answer: They were superstitious that not visiting would curse them
They wanted the income by caring for babies of the wealthy
The variety of shopping options of a nearby city
They were required to pay a debt to the people of Mecca

questions.question: Halimah got to pick Muhammad first because arrived before the other care-takers

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Halimah reluctantly chose to pick him because _________

choices.answer: He was half-orphaned but she didn't want to leave empty-handed
He  would be a lot of work to care for but she didn't want to be ungrateful
He was not from a wealthy family but she was forced by her husband
She wasn't reluctant at all in fact she gladly took him in

questions.question: She went in hopes of wealth from taking a baby, but instead Allah gave her ___________

choices.answer: A strong laborer who joined her party
Buried gold treasure found upon her return
Blessings like her camel became fast and full milk
A burden of work in taking care of babies so she learns humility

questions.question: Halimah returned the Prophet (saaws) exactly on time at the age of 2

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Some of the benefits of early years raised in the desert were:

choices.answer: language is pure [not mixed with slang]
to learn about leadership
safe from sicknesses in the city
to learn how to care for your mother

questions.question: Amina told Halimah to take him back for a few more years because:

choices.answer: There was a widespread disease in Mecca at the time
Because she was very busy and unable to take care of him
Halimah enjoyed his company so much and Amina felt bad for her
Because he didn't want to go back to his mom and leave his friends

questions.question: The Prophet (saaws) was returned to his mother at the age of _____ and she died when he was _______

choices.answer: 5 years old; 6 years old
2 years old; 6 years old
5 years old; 8 years old
5 years old; 12 years old

questions.question: He was then raised by his ___________ who _____________

choices.answer: uncle Abu Talib; was very poor
grandfather Abdul-Muttalib; loved him a lot
grandfather Abdul-Muttalib; was aloof as a busy chieftan
uncle Abu Lahab; was a rich trader

questions.question: His grandfather then passed away when he was ______ and he went into care of ________

choices.answer: 8 years old; his uncle Abu Sufyan
10 years old; his uncle Abu Talib who was closest to his father
12 years old; himself
8 years old; his uncle Abu Talib

questions.question: Abu Talib was ____________ and he took the prophet in because __________

choices.answer: a wealthy man; among his brothers it would be easiest for him
a poor man who had difficulty caring for his family; he loved him very much
not a wealthy man; there were no other uncles to take him in
a wealthy man; he wanted to appear generous in front of others

questions.question: What were some of the divine wisdoms in the tragedies the Prophet had to endure during his childhood

choices.answer: parental influence were minimum; it gave him empathy, compassion, humility
hardship made him firm, strong; it isolated him from befriending people
it made him compliant, sad; he would be more accepting to commands from God
he got better folks to raise him; he could enter into leadership faster

questions.question: Which sura are these verses revealed in?

choices.answer: Sura Al-Fatiha
Sura An-Nas
Sura Ad-Dhuha
Sura Al-Fil

questions.question: 3 ayah show our prophet was: 1. an orphan 2. searching for truth 3. in need. All 3 were solved by Allah alone proving:

choices.answer: it's really important to have parents, schooling, and wealth
the absence of these was not a handicap because Allah is the True Provider
Allah is careful not give the Prophet much so he isn't spoiled
if he had parents to raise him he wouldn't have had to receive Allah's help

questions.question: The Prophet's heart was purified by Angels who opened his chest and removed a speck from it

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: As a child and young man the Prophet acted _________

choices.answer: no different from other boys
with courtesy, shyness and reliability
aggressively and with a strong-will
actively, full of energy and excitement

questions.question: Allah protected the prophet from evil by _______

choices.answer: making bad intentioned people afraid of him and avoid him
isolating him from others because they didn't like he was an orphan
teaching him the Quran and rules from an early age
making him suddenly sleep, feel a slap, or hear a loud voice telling him no

questions.question: When he a child the Prophet (saaws) worked as a _________ to help his uncle

choices.answer: wood-cutter
blacksmith
shepherd
trader

questions.question: When he was 12 years old, his uncle took him on a business trip ______ to __________

choices.answer: North; Syria (Sham)
West; Egypt (Masr)
South; Yemen
North; Persia

questions.question: On that trip they reached a place called Busra where they met a _________ named _________

choices.answer: Jewish monk; Rabbi Zeira
Christian trader; Constantine
Christian monk; Bahirah
Christian monk; Waraqah

questions.question: Bahirah saw the boy and  _______ Abu Talib to __________

choices.answer: advised; take the boy on more expeditions
warned; take good care of him and not expose him to others
warned; stop traveling on business trips
thanked; have the boy bring him back something from his  expedition

questions.question: Christians and Jews were in small isolated enclaves in parts of Arabia because:

choices.answer: They were searching to make a good living buying & selling from Arabs
They were intent on spreading the good word of their religion to pagans
They used to have a vast Arabian empire that they were remnants of
They were following signs in their books that a new prophet would arise

questions.question: Bahirah warned Abu Talib to keep the boy a secret: he feared the Christians & Jews would spoil him with love & wealth

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Bahirah feared they would imprison him or kill him if they find that he arose from amongst the Arabs

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: When the Prophet was 15 years old, this event took place

choices.answer: The Fijar war, it was a quick battle and the Prophet wasn't involved
The rebuilding of the ka'aba because it was in ill repair
The Prophet (saaws) got married to Khadija
The Fijar war which lasted four years and the Prophet collected arrows

questions.question: At the age of 20, '_____ ' was an agreement that was to help restore the Quraysh's honor

choices.answer: The Alliance of Fulan
The Alliance of Fudul
The Alliance of Hudaybiyah
The Alliance of Mecca

questions.question: The Alliance of Fudul was ultimately a flawed alliance because it favored Makkans over foreigners

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: According to the Alliance of Fudul, if anyone suffered injustice, all Makkans would support the victim to bring justice

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: When he was 35 years old, the Ka'aba was in need of reconstruction due to ___________ and _______

choices.answer: an attack; being rotted away by termites
an earthquake; being held up by wooden statues
heavy winds; being made of cheap materials
flood damage; being worn down by age

questions.question: The clans of Quraysh argued and almost battled over who place the black stone for

choices.answer: four to five nights without a resolution until they battled
one day and night until they finally decided to draw straws
four to five nights until they decided the next entrant should choose
they had a hierarchy so they gave it to the highest ranking clan

questions.question: When the Prophet (saaws) entered the gate it ________ them because he was ________

choices.answer: angered; not popular amongst them and they didn't trust him
pleased; from a high-ranking clan that could out-wit the others in battle
frightened; very angry with how childish they were behaving
pleased; respected as the most honest, just, and trustworthy among them

questions.question: He showed much wisdom in resolving the conflict by

choices.answer: deciding none of them should be involved with placing the stone
distributing the honor by having them each hold the stone using his cloak
telling them to draw straws and give to the honor to one with the longest
picking the best among them through voting and having him put the stone
